DataElement.preferredName: Patient Stable Disease or Disorder Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator relating to the stability of a patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: relating to a patient's disease being stable

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Subject to little fluctuation; showing little if any change.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient been stable for a
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient been stable for at least 90 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient is stable (without evidence of progression by imaging using the identical imaging modality for each assessment, either magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) or computed tomography (CT) scan, for at least 4 weeks prior to the first dose of trial treatment, and any neurologic symptoms have returned to baseline).
